title: Iron, "model 1038", 1942–46
medium: Pyrex glass, metal, plastic, rubber, fabric (cord)
markings:
Molded in base of glass shroud: PYREX
Engraved in metal base at foot: Silver Streak
Engraved in metal heel rest: Saunders since 1858/Model 1038/1000 watts/110-120 volts/A-C only
provenance: Carole Krohn, Machine Age, Summerland, CA.
creditline: Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund
description: Broad, oblong wedge-shaped profile comprising one-piece molded transparent glass shroud and handle affixed to white metal soleplate and heel rest. Fabric-covered power cord emerges from tubular rubber flange at top right side. Black plastic dial on red face-plate inscribed:  "Off, On, Rayon, Silk, Wool, Cotton, Linen," and "Low, Med, High."

exhibitions.title: IDEO Selects: Works from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Iron, "model 1038", 1942–46.
1942–46. Pyrex glass, metal, plastic, rubber, fabric (cord). Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund. 1996-39-1.
